intro: Mentha kupcsokiana, commonly known as Hungarian mint, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale purple or blue, arranged in whorls along the stem. Mentha kupcsokiana is valued for its menthol content and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
